parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To long for, covet, lust after, set the heart upon. From epi and thumos; to set the heart upon, i.e. Long for.
To feed, satisfy, fatten. From chortos; to fodder, i.e. to gorge.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.
Probably contracted from tessares and peze; a table or stool, usually for food; also a counter for money.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dog, universally despised in the East. A primary word; a dog.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lick off, lick clean, lick up. From apo and leicho; to lick clean.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A (festering) sore, a wound. Probably from helkuo; an ulcer.
